intro: Diodia breviseta, commonly known as roughleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive rough texture, contributing to its common name. Diodia breviseta is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
